comment: She's nice and fun to talk to but not a great prof. Instructions often not totally clear, can be snarky/condescending, heavy workload and difficult materials. Better than some profs I've had but def has room for improvement. There are better German profs at KSU if you can take them instead, but if you must take her, you'll survive mostly unscathed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This professor automagically assumes people plagiarize.

Would never take again. The worst professor I've ever had an interaction with. Very vague with instructions and extremely disrespectful. Very condescending and the course is just busy work, no respect for her students schedule outside of class or as people. Don't take her class if you want to be treated with respect.

Doktor Smith is a fantastic person and cares very much about the success of her students, not just in class but in life. My biggest complaint is that you can tell she's not super organized, and sometimes her grading criteria aren't super clear or due dates aren't perfectly conveyed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: She's such a good professor. I loved taking her and can't wait to have her again. There is a lot of work, but it is a language so it is to be expected. She is really lenient, which is amazing and kind.

Dr. Smith is a great teacher and she is very passionate about what she does, but there is an enormous amount of work. It is all smooshed into one time frame and she gets frustrated easily when mistakes are made. She always answers questions and is always available. She does love her students, but be ready to dedicate your life to this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I took the 2-week seminar for FL 2209 and I absolutely loved the friendly energy. I've got a lot of social anxiety, but this class made me feel welcome at all times. As a person who despises presenting, it wasn't actually that bad and I never felt judged. I would've loved to take this course in person (would've been in Germany!)
One of the most amazing teachers I have ever had! If you are a modern language and culture student then she is a must take in my opinion. 10/10 cannot express enough how much I love her!

Dr. Smith is so amazing! I've taken her 3 times already, and would take her again. She is so caring and understanding and she cares about you actually understanding and learning. She responds to emails quickly. I still keep contact with her for help on my other language classes and even look up to her as an advisor. Take her!

Dr. Smith is great! She encourages her students to open their minds and to dive into topics around culture. She is incredibly caring and never let's a student get behind. You do write and read a lot but the material is interesting and she has plenty of videos of herself and PowerPoint as reference. You have to participate with discussion posts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: This professor is curteous and understanding. She loves her subject and it is a true pleasure to share that enthusiasm.

Dr. Sabine Smith is a gem at KSU. If you have the opportunity, she is a very valuable asset. I did not take her course, but worked on various projects with her and volunteer such work. She is very inspiring and helpful. Please know this woman.
My favorite professor at KSU. She was so helpful and accomodating. She helped me more than the business advisors did with my business degree! And she teaches German. Lol

I took two classes with her while abroad and it was awesome. She is very thoughtful and legitimately wants you to have a good time while abroad. That being said, you better do good work. She does expect you to care and truly learn.

Dr. Smith is one of the best professors I have ever had in college. She makes every student feel valued in class and I think that is in important. I've taken different classes from her, and all of them are quite interesting. She is a very fair grader, and gives feedback that actually helps you. I would absolutely recommend her to any student!
She's a great Professor. She wants what is best for her students, she will make sure you do well in her class. Show her you're willing to work hard and you will get a good grade.
Great Professor. Wants what is best for her students.

Learning from Dr. Sabine Smith in FL 2209 was truly a wonderful experience. During each class, Dr. Smith encouraged the opportunity for students to interact with and learn from one another. As a result of FL 2209, I am currently pursuing a master's in American Studies--and I owe much of that influence to that of Dr. Smith. I highly recommend!

Dr. Smith really puts a lot of work into her teaching and her students. In all the classes that I have taken with her, she has worked with me every step of the way. Her classes are not difficult if you participate. And she gives you the resources to improve your language skills. Overall, she's a good pick.

Dr. Smith is a serious hard worker and has her hands full with a lot of various things and yet still manages to teach very well! She's very clear about what she wants but if you're willing to work above and beyond she has access to a lot of awesome people, especially with German and abroad opportunities

Professor Smith is devoted to her students' success, and she will do any and everything she can to make her students learn and succeed. You will have to work for every grade she gives you, but if you ever fall behind, she is very understanding. If you put in the effort, she will give you the grade you deserve.

Dr. Smith is a wonderful individual and an inspiring academic. Her advice, feedback, and wisdom is helpful both inside the classroom, and I have learned more from her about German than I have from any other professor at KSU. Wonderful professor.
Dr. Smith is the best!

Dr. Smith is an extremely helpful professor overall and a very dedicated woman. She gives you what you put in. Work hard and you'll get the A. Sit there and do nothing and you'll at best get a C. It's a language course so participation and speaking matter. Lots of extra credit opportunities. She emails back really quick and has good office hours

I've taken Dr. Smith for several study-abroad classes, so I can't attest to her teaching in a class, however, my experiences with her in my situation have been outstanding. She lets you choose your syllabus, works with you on deadlines, usually responds to emails quickly, and genuinely cares about her students. She is very easy to approach.

Dr. Smith is a very hands-on and helpful professor. Shes even willing to bend the rules a bit so long as you are willing to prove that you are putting in the extra effort. Very easily approachable with questions . Usually also very good with emailing back. She will push you to do your best, but her classes require participation-language classes!

I took several German courses with Dr. Smith. She was also my mentor and professor while I was studying abroad in Germany for 11 months. I cannot speak well enough of her teaching and mentoring skills. She challenges her students in the best ways. She is also incredibly supportive and compassionate. Be responsible and communicate. Listen to her.

She is passionate, encouraging, and really cares about your success in the class. Gives lots of choices in assignments and great feedback so you can do better next time. Lots of extra-credit and make-up chances with minimal point loss if you mess up. Stickler for following the guidelines, but if you read and follow the rubrics, anyone can get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I've taken GRMN 3304 and 3305 with Dr. Smith. I found the class enjoyable if a bit easy for me, and a bit easy for a 3000 level, but people come into the class with really different skill levels, and Dr. Smith gives a lot of opportunities for people with different abilities to participate. If you actually do your homework this can be an easy A.

Dr. Smith clearly knows her stuff and is passionate about her subject, but her course was incredibly confusing. Never was grading criteria clearly laid out and she would always refer us to other documents. Additional, she had a short fuse when she felt students weren't listening to her even if they were only confused. Needs to be more understanding

Really nice lady. I enjoyed the class; my only complaint is that the instructions she gave were pretty confusing. I took her hybrid class and she had D2L documents galore.  Often an instruction document would refer to another folder which would refer to another document. But if you take the time to read everything in depth you won't have a problem.
I had to repost my rate, because the previous rating was me. It says average, I would rate her more than average. I just do not know how to edit it.

She is a very smart professor. Her class was fun, and no test, but some projects. Some of the projects, you have to be in groups. I failed because I missed too many classes due to some difficulties from my personal life. It would be a very easy class if I had time to do the work and attend classes. I will not lie just because I failed her class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Smith loves what she teaches, and it shows. She is wonderful at giving constructive feedback. This class had projects that counted a lot, but were doable. The hybrid setup of this class was not a problem, and it'd be great as a normal class, too. No tests, just the projects. The projects had options, too, which was really nice. I recommend her.

Great  class  - not  super  easy  for  me,  but  I  liked  that  she  meets  all  students  where  they  are,  challenges,  and  makes  you  want  to  do  the  work  well.  If  you  have  a  choice,  go  with  her,  and  class  will  be  fun  (and  funny,  too).

Easy A took for maymester. Lots of reading but easy &  doable.2 presentations, 4 lpg blogs, mid&fin take home super easy. Working on the final, mid, or presentation n a group is optional. Class is very laid back come & voice your opinions about the readings. If you miss a day u don't miss a lot she posts everything on D2L anyways! She is very nice.

Dr. Smith is great! She's flexible and really tries to work with students. If there's anything that people are having a hard time with, she is there to help. I took this as a Maymester class and it was a lot of work, but do-able if you stayed on top of things and didn't procrastinate. She was great about getting input from the class.

Dr. Smith goes the extra mile - all the time! Not only for her students when she talks to you 1:1 about your progress in class , but also when she provides you with publication opportunities so that your resume looks great. I recommend taking her class if you want a teacher who cares that you'll make an A - she really works with you.

She is funny, and she CARES about all of her students. She takes us one step at a time, and I can't believe how much I learnt in just one semester. You do better if you work with the website and the book, and if you study. She makes class and learning fun - great visuals and learning tricks all the time. I felt absolutely prepared for all tests.

She is a great professor and she challenges you in many ways. If you are not up for a challenge and learning something from it, then don't take her. Yes, she is all over the place, but while in class, she makes a 100% sure that everyone is on the same page and is willing to over and beyond to help her students achieve in her class.

She is a very knowledgible professor. Sometimes her directions can be confussing, but she usually asks if students understand in class. Her midterm and final exam were both take home. Understanding poetry in another language is difficult. You will learn in her class though. Work hard and diligently and you will do well. I recommend her.

Horrible!  Her instructions are all over the place on the projects.  Mid term and final are short-essay answers, but there are 5-10 pages of questions!  Did I say her instructions are ambiguous?  And when you ask her to clarify she gets mad.  You have to interview 3 foreign people in your community for a project.  Luckily I was able to withdraw.

I would have to say that Frau Smith is highly knowledgeable about German, especially since she is from Germany.  However, her class entails a copious amount of work and the class moves very quickly.  She can also be quite condescending.

I can honestly say that Frau Smith is one of the best teachers at KSU. I have known her for close to 3 years now and have never had another teacher as imaginative as her. I am actually living in Germany now with a government funded program, and I can give all the thanks to her. Foreign language is hard, what do you expect? I highly recommend her:)

very good teacher- not very very easy but clear and helpful. I learned more german in her class than in any other german class. Interested in trying new, or unconventional methods as long as they work: She really is interested in TEACHING you something! Great teacher.
OH MY GOSH! run if you can...I want my money back

She is a very nice woman and quite lenient with deadlines. She gives you the opportunity to decided if you want to have an in-class or take home exam. But the quizzes and tests were very lengthy and a lot of work. She is a bit of a scatterbrain and unorganized. I really didn't feel like I learned much in her class.
I like that she is always trying new pedagogic strategies to make learning a foreing language easy. She also allows the class to decide if the exams are open note exams or not.

We had to take that German class that was almost canceled.  Smith offered us to work at that Elementary   School instead??? Talking about internship and teaching little children ... Wow, talk about something TOTALLY different ... I quickly left the class.  Crazy woman.

This is a fun class that can be very beneficial to World History majors. She lets the class decide whether tests are in class or take-home (in my opinion this is awesome). Also, a big chunk of your overall grade is based on presentations - these are an easy A as you only have to speak for 5 mins max.  To summerize - take this class b/c she is great

Loved the class! Dr. Smith has a very progressive approach to teaching, which I really enjoyed. Although I did not enjoy the note collecting, she did give everybody the chance to succeed by providing a variety of assignments (group/individual presentations, group-work encouraged take-home midterm and final, collection of worksheets).

Even though the class has a lot of information, she is always willing to help you out, even with personal problems. She treats you like an adult and the students have a lot of say in midterm and final formats. Be prepared to take notes, because she collects them!

This class has ALOT of information.  A little too much.  Alot of the work is like busy work and we only had a mid-term and a final in which both were take-home.  They were fairly easy.  Your expected to take notes EVERYDAY and after a few weeks she collects the notes and grades them pretty harsh!

I am very interesed in the subject and am ususally a good student, but could not make a good grade in her class, no matter how hard I tried. She gives you a lot of "busy work" and assignments that feel like babysitting (stuff to turn in just to prove you were in class). Unclear instructions, rushing through the material,and uncompromising teacher

I enjoyed this class. There is a lot of work, but it is not really difficult stuff. She is not too tough when she grades, and she lets everyone know exactly what she expects for an A. I think that Dr. Smith is an excellent and thoughtful professor who likes to teach.
Very knowledgeable because German is her native language, but doesn't necessarily teach it well.  Seems very condescending.

HARDEST prof in this whole world.she is out to get you.make sure you are a hardworking german before you take herclass because she will work you like a german.6 poster,4 presentation,3 essay,takehome midterm,1 hard final,6 surveys,4 interviews,group work.not a language class but business class.donot

Class is difficult to adjust to at first if there's people who've already taken German in your class. But Frau Smith has a great teaching style that helps tremendously.  Study and the class will be fine.  Only downside: the roleplays- a bit nervewracking!
Good instructor.  Cannot miss class or you will fall behind.  Tough but fair.
